oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bluegrass Nights at the Ryman (1995)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Banjo; Bluegrass music; Logos (Symbols); Martha White Foods; Metal photoplates; Musical instruments; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.);
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Three color window card (blue, red, and yellow on white) announcing the schedule for Bluegrass Night at the Ryman. Bluegrass Nights are Tuesday nights at the Ryman Auditorium from June 13 to August 29 and feature performers such as Bill Monroe and the Bluegrass Boys, Alison Krauss and Union Station, and Ralph Stanley and the Clinch Mountain Boys. Poster features metal photoplates of the Ryman Auditorium and the Bluegrass Nights logo.
